review_title: Great place to learn and grow
pros: Having a smaller IT department, you will be able to stretch yourself and your responsibilities to learn and grow as an IT professional. Overall, the environment is less intense in comparison to other industries which cultivates an environment for learning, growing confidence, and stretching your abilities if that is what you desire. Great work/life balance with plenty of time off.
cons: Budgets can be tight and ridged since it is State funded, especially for a constantly evolving and demanding IT environments and budget. As a pro, it teaches you to be more resourceful and money conscious but can also hinder your ability to provide the best services to the faculty, staff, and students. Related to the above, salaries are not competitive compared to other markets. For what you lack in compensation, you gain in PTO and a great environment to work and learn new skills.

job_title: Information Technology Technician in Monroe, NC
pros: SPCC is a great opportunity to work in a learning environment. If you're a student or learning on your own on how basic IT work is done, then this is the place for you. For the most part, people here are extremely friendly and consist of little to no drama. Mainly a professional environment but also very laid back if you can do your work efficiently within a timely manner. In addition, you can also have perks working for the state.
cons: You work for the state, therefor pay is bad (as a part timer). You get underpaid for the effort you put in. Although the workplace is professional, you may have some coworkers who are not team players. Communication lacks between people. Also, you cannot move upwards toward your department. Once you get a position, that's the position you'll be in. Oh and you don't get any raises (even after working there for 2 years).

review_title: Loyalty is rewarded more than effective skills, intelligence, kindness or hard work. Beware.
pros: Many instructors and staff are hard working, committed and kind people. State benefits are a plus. There are good people here. Most of them are not in higher positions. Probably an adequate place for people who are new to the work force.
cons: The good people mentioned above are not routinely recognized and are leaving in droves. Those who are left are those who have proven their loyalty by doing the dirty work for their superiors and obeying all the rules at all costs and at the expense of honest people's lives. Being thrown under the bus is common place. Trust is at a minimum. Don't expect open communication. Positions are vacated and not filled, leaving a lot of work for a few people to do.
